009package imagingbook.common.morphology;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013/** 
014 * This class defines static methods related to binary
015 * structuring elements (kernels).
016 * 
017 * @author WB
018 *
019 */
020public abstract class StructuringElements {
021        
022        private StructuringElements() {}
023
024        /**
025         * Creates and returns a square binary structuring element (kernel)
026         * of size 3x3 (radius 1).
027         * 
028         * @return a 3x3 binary box kernel
029         */
030        public static byte[][] makeBoxKernel3x3() {
031                return makeBoxKernel(1);
032        }
033
034        /**
035         * Creates and returns a square binary "box" kernel
036         * with the specified radius. The kernel size is
037         * (2 * radius + 1) x (2 * radius + 1). It is always odd.
038         * 
039         * @param radius the kernel radius
040         * @return a square binary box kernel
041         */
042        public static byte[][] makeBoxKernel(int radius) {
043                int r = (int) Math.rint(radius);
044                if (r <= 1)
045                        r = 1;
046                int n = r + r + 1;
047                byte[][] H = new byte[n][n];
048                for (int v = 0; v < H.length; v++) {
049                        for (int u = 0; u < H[v].length; u++) {
050                                H[v][u] = 1;
051                        }
052                }
053                return H;
054        }
055
056        // TODO: compare to CircularMask (filters), define BinaryKernel class?
057        /**
058         * Creates and returns a square binary "disk" kernel
059         * with the specified radius. The kernel size is
060         * (2 * radius + 1) x (2 * radius + 1). It is always odd.
061         * 
062         * @param radius the kernel radius
063         * @return a square binary disk kernel
064         */
065        public static byte[][] makeDiskKernel(double radius) {
066                int r = (int) Math.rint(radius);        // size of kernel (use ceil?)
067                if (r < 1) r = 1;
068                int n = r + r + 1;
069                byte[][] kernel = new byte[n][n];
070                double r2 = sqr(radius);
071                for (int v = -r; v <= r; v++) {
072                        for (int u = -r; u <= r; u++) {
073                                if (sqr(u) + sqr(v) <= r2)
074                                        kernel[v + r][u + r] = 1;
075                        }
076                }
077                return kernel;
078        }
079
080        /**
081         * Converts the specified {@code int[][]}
082         * to a {@code byte[][]}, which is returned.
083         * 
084         * @param iA the {@code int[][]} array to be converted
085         * @return the resulting {@code byte[][]}
086         */
087        public static byte[][] toByteArray(int[][] iA) {
088                byte[][] bA = new byte[iA.length][];
089                for (int i = 0; i < iA.length; i++) {
090                        bA[i] = new byte[iA[i].length];
091                        for (int j = 0; j < iA[i].length; j++) {
092                                bA[i][j] = (byte) iA[i][j];
093                        }
094                }               
095                return bA;
096        }
097
098        /**
099         * Returns a copy of the specified structuring element
100         * that is mirrored along both axes. For example
101         * <pre>
102         * | A B |
103         * | C D |</pre>
104         * converts to
105         * <pre>
106         * | D C |
107         * | B A |</pre>
108         * 
109         * @param H the original structuring element
110         * @return the reflected structuring element
111         */
112        public static byte[][] reflect(byte[][] H) {
113                // mirrors (transposes) the structuring element around the center (hot spot)
114                // used to implement erosion by a dilation
115                final int n = H.length;                 // number of rows
116                final int m = H[0].length;              // number of columns
117                byte[][] rH = new byte[n][m];
118                for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
119                        for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
120                                rH[j][i] = H[n - j - 1][m - i - 1];
121                        }
122                }
123                return rH;
124        }
125        
126        
127//      @Deprecated
128//      public void showStructuringElement() {
129//              show(H, "Structuring Element");
130//      }
131
132//      public static void show(byte[][] matrix, String title) {
133//              int w = matrix[0].length;
134//              int h = matrix.length;
135//              ImageProcessor ip = new ByteProcessor(w, h);
136//              for (int v = 0; v < h; v++) {
137//                      for (int u = 0; u < w; u++) {
138//                              if (matrix[v][u] == 1)
139//                                      ip.putPixel(u, v, 255);
140//                              else
141//                                      ip.putPixel(u, v, 0);
142//                      }
143//              }
144//              ip.invertLut();
145//              ImagePlus im = new ImagePlus(title, ip);
146//              
147//              im.show();
148//      }
149        
150
151}
